intro: Diodia gardneri, commonly known as wild betony, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its small, blue to purple flowers are arranged in whorled clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Diodia gardneri is often found in moist, wooded areas and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
